text: Frank Edward Young (September 1, 1931 â€“ November 24, 2019) was an American physician. He was Commissioner of Food and Drugs from 1984 to 1989 and later as a Deputy Assistant Secretary in the United States Department of Health and Human Services during the Ronald Reagan presidency. Young died of lymphoma on November 24, 2019, in Wilmington, North Carolina at age 88. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from lymphoma Category:American physicians Category:Commissioners of the Food and Drug Administration Category:Scientists from New York (state)
title: Frank E. Young (physician)
